perturbation.original_text: Club owns and operates the National Football League (“NFL”) team known as the Jacksonville Jaguars (the “Team”) and has the right to grant sponsorship rights and to exploit certain commercial, advertising and related opportunities with respect to the Team, including at the football-based stadium in Jacksonville, Florida currently named EverBank Field (the “Stadium”).
perturbation.changed_text: Club owns and operates the National Football League (“NFL”) team known as the Jacksonville Jaguars (the “Team”) and has the right to grant sponsorship rights and to exploit certain commercial, advertising and related opportunities with respect to the Team, including at the football-based facility in Jacksonville, Florida currently named EverBank Field (the “Stadium”).
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'stadium' to 'facility' introduces ambiguity. While 'stadium' has an implicit understanding related to sporting events, 'facility' is a broader term, potentially conflicting with specific NFL regulations regarding advertising within designated 'stadium' areas. This vague term could be interpreted differently, thereby creating misaligned terminology.
perturbation.contradicted_law: NFL advertising regulations and stadium naming rights agreements.

perturbation.original_text: Sponsor shall receive three (3) minutes of real time (and not game clock time) of display of a Sponsor Mark on LED carousel Signage on one (1) of the main video boards above the north or south end zone during each quarter of each preseason and regular season Jaguars Home Game. During each three (3) minute segment, Sponsor may include up to thirty seconds (:30) of animated messaging. Sponsor shall be solely responsible for any costs related to the animated messaging.
perturbation.changed_text: Sponsor shall receive three (3) minutes of potential display time of a Sponsor Mark on LED carousel Signage on one (1) of the main video boards above the north or south end zone during each quarter of each preseason and regular season Jaguars Home Game. During each three (3) minute segment, Sponsor may include up to thirty seconds (:30) of animated messaging. Sponsor shall be solely responsible for any costs related to the animated messaging.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'real time' to 'potential display time' significantly weakens the guarantee of advertising exposure. "Potential display time" is vague and doesn't ensure actual airtime, conflicting with the expectation set by the initial agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida advertising laws regarding deceptive or misleading advertising.

perturbation.original_text: For purposes of clarity, Club reserves the right to sell other products at the Stadium competitive to the Sponsor Business.
perturbation.changed_text: For purposes of clarity, Club reserves the right to sell other products at the facility competitive to the Sponsor Business.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Stadium' to 'facility' is again introducing ambiguity. While 'Stadium' has an implicit understanding related to sporting events, 'facility' is a broader term. This vague term could be interpreted differently, thereby creating misaligned terminology.
perturbation.contradicted_law: NFL advertising regulations and stadium naming rights agreements.
